title: How is sociology for the UPSC Mains? - Quora

response.answer_text: Sociology for UPSC mains is trending as data suggest (data based on 2013–2018 final results). One candidate in top 10 every year, including Rank 1, Rank 2, & Rank 3 in different 2 years.5–10 candidates in top 100 every year.Every year max score is crossing 300 out of 500 for many candidates. Many of them scoring more than 320.Average score of selected candidates remain 270+ which is an standard score.Smaller syllabus.Easy to understand.Can be covered in 60 days by 3–4 hours study daily.Can be revised in 12–15 days study only.Not a risky subject, since average score remains high in comparison to other Optional.Study materials, coaching notes etc easily available in English and Hindi medium.‘SOCIOLOGY optional” is an aspirants (mains oriented sincere aspirants) based discplined group on what's app to practice answer writng daily. …access through 8174800601.Standard Books - Harlombus Orange Book, IGNOU, Ritzer, Aditya Mogra, Nitin Sangwan, Upendra IAS Notes, Mahapatra sir Notes. Nadeem Hasnain, Ram Ahuja.

Thanks for A2A!!! It's absolutely fine if you like the subject …any subject in which u are interested u can score better in that subject + if the subject is of your graduation subject then the task will be more easier for you .. So first of all shortlist 3 subjects for optional if you are so confused…then take syllabus of all three and analyse the topics of syllabus thoroughly..and then take a glance of previous year papers okkk complete this task in 3–5 days … Make the book list for all … Then check it out if you are able to cope up with the subject + getting all book resource +interested in the subject choose that one …okay…Every optional subjects has its own merits and demerits so you have to decide the subjects based on this main 3 factor as mentioned above … Good luck !!!
